availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John Holeman, Jr. (Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmer. Caldwell County, Kentucky, native. Married to Jane B. Morse Holeman in Caldwell County, Kentucky, on October 16, 1848. Father of John A. Holeman, William F. Holeman, James M. Holeman, Jesse Holeman, Daniel K. Holeman, and Pantiler G. Holeman. Married to Alcy Holeman. Father of Martha Holeman. Farmer in Caldwell County in 1850. Farmer in Caldwell County in 1860.Owned five enslaved persons in Caldwell County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 1, p. 283A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 96.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 226A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Williams Mill, p. 546A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Caldwell County Marriages, Film #000851644.
"John Holeman (1826-1921)," Find A Grave, Memorial #47186682, accessed January 24, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/47186682.
